Title: Youths should be meaningfully engaged before backing politicians for re-election
Summary: South East youths have declared their condition to work for and/or support the re-election of public office holders seeking return, including President Bola Ahmed Tinubu . They also said that for fresh seekers of elective offices, their verifiable disposition towards youth was verifiable .

Title: First batch of Jigawa pilgrims returns from Saudi Arabia
Summary: The Max Air flight, carrying 549 pilgrims, landed at the Nuhu Muhammad Sanusi International Airport in Dutse, Nigeria . The first batch of pilgrims from Jigawa State has returned safely .

Title: Speculations grow over David Mark’s ADC leadership bid
Summary: Speculations grow over David Mark’s leadership bid . African Democratic Congress (ADC) is navigating a critical moment of transition, and at its helm, party founder and National Chairman David Mark .

Title: Nigeria to plant 20 billion trees for environmental sustainability – Shettima
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima has announced that Nigeria will plant 20 billion trees during the next rainy season as part of its national  sustainability programmes . Vice-President Kashim said the country will plant the trees during its national rainy season .

Title: FIRS rewards MSME outfit with N2m, car for tax compliance
Summary: Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) rewarded a Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise (MSME) operator, Raw Food and Beauty Research Ltd, with two million Naira cash and a brand-new car for outstanding tax compliance .

Title: Inter Miami weaker team but capable of shocking PSG – Mascherano
Summary: Inter Miami face Paris Saint-Germain in the last 16 of the Club World Cup on Sunday . Javier Mascherano admits his Inter Miami side are weaker team but capable of shocking PSG . Inter Miami play the French champions in their last 16 clash in Miami .

Title: Rotational presidency imperative to keep Nigeria one, united – Shehu Sani
Summary: Shehu Sani says rotating the office of the president between the north and south is imperative to keep Nigeria one and united . He made the statement in an interview with the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) on Sunday in Abuja .

Title: One killed, three injured as FCT police foil Apo robbery in gun battle
Summary: One person was killed and three others injured during a gun battle with armed robbers in the Apo Resettlement area of Abuja . Federal Capital Territory (FCT) Police Command has confirmed that one was killed .

Title: ‘Account for security votes spending, invite EFCC, ICPC’, SERAP tells governors
Summary: Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project (SERAP) sent Freedom of Information (FOI) requests to Nigeria’s 36 state governors . SERAP urges them to “promptly account for the spending of public funds in the name of ‘security votes’

Title: WAFCON 2025: Nigeria vs Ghana – date, time, where to watch
Summary: Nigeria's Super Falcons go head-to-head with Ghana's Black Queens in a much-anticipated international friendly, dubbed the Jollof Derby . The stage is set for another classic West African rivalry .

Title: Man arrested for kidnapping friend, collecting ₦5.3m ransom in Anambra
Summary: The Anambra State Police Command has arrested a 24-year-old male suspect, Muanaenye Victor, for allegedly luring his friend to be kidnapped by his criminal gang in Uli, Ihiala area of the state . PUNCH Online gathered that the suspect planned the kidnapping and collected a ransom in dollars equivalent

Title: Indecent dressing now attracts N50,000 fine, police warn Delta residents
Summary: The Delta State Police Command has warned residents that indecent dressing will attract penalties under the state’s Violence Against Persons Prohibition Law . Individuals found guilty of indecent dressing risk a fine of ₦50,000 or a sentence of community service . The VAPP Act, originally signed into law in 2015 by former President Goodluck Jonathan,

Title: Dantata's legacy of philanthropy inspiring — Peter Obi
Summary: Former Anambra State governor and 2023 Labour Party presidential candidate, Peter Obi, has mourned the passing of elder statesman and billionaire industrialist, Aminu Dantata . Obi, in a condolence message shared via his X handle on Saturday, said the late businessman’s life was marked by simplicity, service,

Title: VIDEO: Dont help carry unknown nags, NDLEA warns travellers
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency has issued a fresh warning to travellers, urging them never to carry any luggage they did not personally pack or whose contents they do not fully know . The caution came from the agency’s Director of Media and Advocacy, Femi Babafemi, who shared the message via his X (formerly Twitter

Title: First Hajj pilgrims' flight arrive Jigawa
Summary: According to the Jigawa State Pilgrims Welfare Board, the first flight, Max Air, arrived at about 2:57 pm, carrying 549 male and female pilgrims .
